data.title: On the Black Hill by Bruce Chatwin, First Edition
data.meta_description: On the Black Hill by Chatwin, Bruce and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition, first impression. Author's third novel. Sl lean, otherwise Near Fine in a Near Fine d/w with browning to the inside of the wrapper, not seen on the outside/.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Dustiness to top of text block; pushing to top of DJ; spots of foxing to flaps; a tiny bit of fading to very top of front board. Still lovely bright copy in lovely designed DJ and Chatwinesque pale blue boards that appears unread inside.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. A fine copy in a fine jacket. A clean copy with price ($14.75) intact on front flap. Comes with archival-quality jacket protector. Note: Light wrinkling (and damp-stain on lower-left corner) on front jacket cover. Damp-staining on top edge of an otherwise nice copy. Won the James Tait Black Memorial Prize. Adapted into film of the same name in 1987.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 249pp. 22cm. Hardcover. Publisher's original black cloth and paper over boards, gilt lettering to spine. Book Condition: faint signs of handling, else fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Virtually as new. This copy is one those happy accidents that got two dust jackets at the printer's preserving the second one from sunlight, handling wear and everything else. A v. sharp copy of Chatwin's third book, second novel. First Printing of First American Edition.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Picador published by Pan Books. UK. 1983. 'On The Black Hill' by Bruce Chatwin. This book is a Paperback. First edition in this format. Covers are bright and clean with very good edges and tips, spine is complete with very fine and superficial crease, it is not broken. Contents are age toned otherwise clean and unmarked. A handsome, unread copy. Bruce Chatwin won the James Tait Black Memorial Prize for 'On The Black Hill' in 1982. A novel set on the Herefordshire/Radnorshire border and covers the lives of identical twins over the course of eighty years. Not exlib and packed and sent with care.

First American Edition. First Printing. Octavo (22cm); gray paper boards over black cloth spine, with titles stamped in silver on spine; dustjacket; 249pp. Fine copy. In the original dustjacket, price clipped but free of toning or soil; Near Fine. Winner of the Whitbread Prize and the James Tait Black Memorial Prize (1982). Basis for the Film of the same name directed by Andrew Grieves in 1987.

Hardcover. Condition: About Fine. First Edition. Correct 1st edition of the author's 2nd novel, 3rd book overall. Light touch of fading to the very top edge of the boards else fine in fine, very lightly spine-faded dw. A very nice copy!.

FIRST EDITION. 8vo. Grey cloth, spine lettered in gilt. Gentle pushing to spine ends, light spotting to top edge. Else, clean and tight. In Mon Mohan's atmospheric dust jacket: price-clipped, light creasing to top edge and heel of spine. A nice, bright copy of Chatwin's first novel, which won him the James Tait Black Memorial Prize, as well as the Whitbread First Novel of the Year Award. Very good/ very good.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. 249 pp, a novel. previous owner's inked name & date ffep, 5.5" x 8.7" black cloth backed, gilt spine letters, gray papered boards, in white illustrated, unclipped, DJ with acetate protector. Binding tight & square, pages clean, unmarked, paper well-preserved. Little or no wear to exterior. Size: Thin Octavo. Book.
